meanings.definition: In a way that conveys a warning or reprimand.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him admonishingly when he tried to touch the fragile vase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher spoke admonishingly to the students about the importance of following the rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed admonishingly at the dog who was about to knock over a glass of water.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered admonishingly, warning of the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: His mother's eyes glared admonishingly, signaling him to stop misbehaving.

meanings.sent1: The poster on the wall had an admonishingly serious tone, reminding everyone to be safe.
meanings.sent2: Her admonishingly strict rules kept the children from getting into trouble.
meanings.sent3: The old, admonishingly creaky stairs made a spooky sound as she climbed them.
meanings.sent4: The admonishingly bright red color of the stop sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The admonishingly loud alarm blared, warning of the approaching danger.
